event.title: <show-title>Dune (2021)</show-title> <event-type-title>Reissue</event-type-title>
event.headline: Revisit the first chapter of Denis Villeneuve's DUNE
event.description: DUNE (2021) returns to the big screen with a triumphant limited engagement in select theaters. Award‚Äêwinning director Denis Villeneuve directs the big‚Äêscreen adaptation of Frank Herbert‚Äôs seminal bestseller. A mythic and emotionally charged hero‚Äôs journey, tells the story of Paul Atreides, a brilliant and gifted young man born into a great destiny beyond his understanding, who must travel to the most dangerous planet in the universe to ensure the future of his family and his people. As malevolent forces explode into conflict over the planet‚Äôs exclusive supply of the most precious resource in existence ‚Äì a commodity capable of unlocking humanity‚Äôs greatest potential ‚Äì only those who can conquer their fear will survive.

You‚Äôre encouraged to wear your ‚Äò80s best for this fresh, interactive screening of Diablo Cody‚Äôs hilarious horror comedy. We‚Äôll even have some themed props to help you finish your look, including inflatable microphones, sunglasses, lace gloves, and more.

show.title: The Blair Witch Project
show.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT

event.title: <show-title>The Blair Witch Project</show-title>
event.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT
event.description:
In October 1994, three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, to make a documentary about the mythical Blair Witch. What starts off as a straightforward piece slowly becomes more and more mysterious and terrifying. Soon the filmmakers care more about finding their way out of the woods than making a film... A year later, their footage was found.

For better or worse, THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT has become one of ‚Äì if not the most ‚Äì influential modern horror films. Its simplistic premise and found-footage technique (or gimmick, depending on who you ask) have had countless imposters over the last 15 years, but none of them have come close to achieving the effectiveness that BLAIR WITCH encompasses. Famously shot for $60,000, the film made a staggering, game-changing $250 million worldwide at the box office and became a phenomenon. What seems to have gotten lost over the years is that this is still a first-rate horror film.

show.headline: When you can live forever, what do you live for?

event.title: <show-title>Twilight (2008)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say the name of this impossibly fun & interactive screening out loud‚Ä¶Movie Party
event.description:
You better hold on tight, spider monkey, because we‚Äôve got an interactive screening for you that shines brighter than Edward‚Äôs skin on a sunny day.

While that might be the skin of a killer, it‚Äôs the face that launched a thousand fans, and we‚Äôre bringing as many as we can together for our TWILIGHT Movie Party. Not only will it feature Edward‚Äôs steely charisma and maybe the best baseball scene ever put to film, it‚Äôll have themed props like blood vials (mini ketchup bottles), TITSOAK sunglasses to let everyone know that you have the skin of a killer, and vampire teeth that you‚Äôll fall unconditionally and irrevocably in love with.

So start working on your tan, book a flight to Forks, and join us for a night of bloodthirsty fun you‚Äôll remember for the next 100 years of being 17.

show.title: In the Mood for Love
show.headline: Wong Kar-Wai's mesmerizing tale of love never realized

landscapeHeroImage.altText: In the mood for love sp hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: In the mood for love sp hero

posterImages.altText: In the mood for love poster

event.title: <show-title>In the Mood for Love</show-title>
event.headline: Wong Kar-Wai mesmerizing tale of love never realized.
event.description:
‚ÄúHe remembers those vanished years. As though looking through a dusty window pane, the past is something he could see, but not touch. And everything he sees is blurred and indistinct.‚Äù

If my life was a movie, I would want it to be a Wong Kar-wai film. Not because they're particularly happy, but damn, all the sad shit that happens will be exceptionally alluring and grand. Maybe, I just want immaculately tailored garments and a killer score? ANYWHO, I digress. Dreamy, surreal, and achingly beautiful, Wong Kar-wai‚Äôs 2000 period drama IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is quite simply one of the most romantic films ever made. In 1962 British Hong Kong, neighbors Chow Mo-wan (Tony Leung) and Su Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) begin to develop an intimate companionship after they realize their respective spouses are having an affair. Will they surrender to their desire and loneliness? Or will they spend several years longingly glancing at each other during beautiful slow-motion shots? There‚Äôs nothing queerer than lingering repression and yearning, y‚Äôall. Dripping with aesthetic drama and gorgeous cinematography, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is a film that demands watching on the biggest screen possible. If you‚Äôve never seen this film DON‚ÄôT PANIC because now‚Äôs your chance, but remember, if you miss this opportunity, you might just spend the rest of your life wondering what might have been.

4k DCP courtesy of Janus Films.

show.title: Army of Darkness
show.headline: Trapped in time. Surrounded by evil. Low on gas.

event.title: <show-title>Army of Darkness</show-title>
event.headline: Come get some in 35mm
event.description:
Ash is back. And he brought his boomstick! The concluding chapter of Sam Raimi's original EVIL DEAD trilogy, ARMY OF DARKNESS picks up minutes after EVIL DEAD II, as Ash (Bruce Campbell) travels back in time to face an army of Dark Age Deadites. Chock-full of gorgeous practical effects, crazed slapstick, and endlessly quotable dialogue, this is ground zero for action-horror-comedies that make you feel truly grateful to be part of the human race.

Screening an archival 35mm print courtesy of Universal Pictures in Austin and San Francisco

show.title: Evil Dead (2013)
show.headline: At this point, why even go to the woods?

event.title: <show-title>Evil Dead (2013)</show-title>
event.headline: At this point, why even go to the woods?
event.description:
The Evil Dead series has gone every which way, from brutal backwoods shocks to manic slapstick; it‚Äôs in its elasticity that the films find their brilliance. So how would a remake without the Raimi/Campbell duo front-and-center fare? Turns out, pretty damn good. Filmmaker Fede √Ålvarez‚Äôs iteration of cabin fever doesn‚Äôt skimp on gore and shocks, with Jane Levy‚Äôs performance acting as the dramatic fulcrum keeping it all in place, beyond all of the nails and splinters and other objects getting lodged in people‚Äôs faces. (Jake Isgar)

DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures

show.title: Evil Dead II
show.headline: Does a more perfect movie exist? Who‚Äôs to say?

event.title: <show-title>Evil Dead II</show-title>
event.headline: Does a more perfect movie exist? Who‚Äôs to say?
event.description: If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, then Sam Raimi must be the happiest person on earth. Not content with creating one of the most ferocious lo-fi horror movies ever, Raimi one-upped himself by reimagining the original EVIL DEAD as a parody. And a sequel. The gonzo, ultra-creative EVIL DEAD 2 reunites the iconic Ash (Bruce Campbell) with a possessed cabin in the woods. But this time, Raimi and co-writer Scott Spiegel weren't happy with simply fashioning chainsaws as hands, decapitating demons, and filling up rooms with blood. They wanted more!! And so, the spirit of EVIL DEAD was combined with the mystique of Val Lewton, the energy of Looney Tunes, and the slapstick of The Three Stooges to create the definitive horror head-rush of 1987. And also all years forever after infinity. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

show.title: Kung Fu Hustle
show.headline: Stephen Chow's Looney Tunes gangster comedy.

event.title: <show-title>Kung Fu Hustle</show-title>
event.headline: Stephen Chow's Looney Tunes gangster comedy.
event.description:
Stephen Chow co-wrote, produced and directed this 2004 Chinese action comedy that brought Chuck Jones-inspired cartoon violence into the world of Hong Kong martial arts. Featuring over-the-top slapstick stunts, KUNG FU HUSTLE stars Chow as a wannabe gangster whose habit of impersonating members of the notoriously dangerous Axe Gang lands him in hot water once he runs afoul of the legendary group of thugs and murderers. It's up to the residents of a housing complex -- all retired martial arts master -- to help the opportunistic miscreant discover the hero he has buried inside. The supporting cast includes a who's who list of Hong Kong action cinema veterans including Yuan Wah, Yuen Qui, Danny Chan and Bruce Leung.

Combining laugh-out-loud stunts and lovable characters, Stephen Chow helps bridge the gap between Buster Keaton and Jackie Chan. Find out why legendary comedian Bill Murray calls KUNG FU HUSTLE "the supreme achievement of the modern age in terms of comedy." (Robert Saucedo)

35mm print courtesy of Sony Pictures Classics.

show.title: Switchblade Sisters
show.headline: Jack Hill's Shakespearean girl gang gutter epic

event.title: <show-title>Switchblade Sisters</show-title>
event.headline: Jack Hill's Shakespearean girl gang gutter epic
event.description:
The iconic girl gang hit from Jack Hill, legendary director of SPIDER BABY, COFFY, and FOXY BROWN! Lace (Robbie Lee), the leader of girl gang The Dagger Debs, meets her match when new girl Maggie (Joanne Nail) moves into the neighborhood. Conflict turns to friendship as the girls end up in juvie together. Meanwhile, The Silver Daggers, the ladies‚Äôs male counterparts, have to contend with the arrival of a new gang, led by the villainous Crabs (Chase Newhart). But when the girls get back on the streets, a planned retaliation strike in tandem with The Silver Daggers backfires and puts Lace in hospital. Maggie assumes control, teaming up with Muff (Marlene Clark) and her gang of Black militants to declare all out war. Filled with sharp, clever dialogue and tongue in cheek humor, this Shakespeare-influenced girl gang mash-up is a stone cold 1970s classic.

Restoration courtesy of Arrow Video and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: They Came Together
show.headline: A ridiculous rom-com spoof from the creators of WET HOT AMERICAN SUMMER

event.title: <show-title>They Came Together</show-title>
event.headline: A ridiculous rom-com spoof from the creators of WET HOT AMERICAN SUMMER
event.description: In the tradition of mind-meltingly silly parody movies such as AIRPLANE! and THE NAKED GUN, THEY CAME TOGETHER deconstructs romantic comedies with a sledgehammer screenplay by The State/Stella/WET HOT AMERICAN SUMMER's Michael Showalter and David Wain and some A+ clowning from stars Paul Rudd and Amy Poehler. Though less than a decade old, it's already drifting into obscurity, so let's correct the course of history and make this absolutely hilarious comedy the cult audience favorite it should have been in 2014.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We‚Äôd love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
